sub_topic: Finding the phase shift of trigonometric functions
message_1: A math student needs to find the phase shift for the trigonometric function f(x) = 2cos(x-π/3). What is the value of the phase shift?
message_2:
The phase shift of a trigonometric function is the horizontal shift applied to the function. In the given function f(x) = 2cos(x - π/3), the phase shift can be found inside the cosine function as the value being subtracted from x.

In this case, the phase shift is π/3.
